info.name: Streetcar Suburb
info.attribution:
This is an original game by Drew Edwards available under CC BY-NC 4.0. The hex board, the rules overlay, and the library image are also available under CC BY-NC 4.0.

The cube design, coding, and room layout are by LawDawg and are released to the Public Domain under CC0.
info.description: Transform an unsustainable suburb of single-family houses into an affordable, diverse, and walkable town. Remove single-family housing limits to let citizens build, then connect new buildings with streetcar lines of your own color to score points.
info.ruleText: Click on the rules button in the upper left corner of the room when sitting in a seat to display the rules.
info.helpText:
Players sit in seats. Press the restart button to begin and assign a random starting player.

The area over the map is a drawing canvas. Click and drag to draw a line between hexes. The player whose turn it is has their player color set as the active drawing color. To change to the other player's color use either the turn button or click on the colored pen icon at the bottom of the page near the player's seat. To erase part of a drawing, click on the eraser icon near the player's seat.

Drag and drop houses into the holders above the player's seat. Cubes stack on top of each other and can be dragged as a group.

fields.text: This will completely reset the board and start a new game. Are you sure?

If you need functions that activate whenever there is a status change (being used or not), add those at the end of this clickRoutine.
